DOC.brief_summary: The Fractional Flow Reserve Fax Registry investigator-initiated , real-world registry analyze use fractional flow reserve ( FFR ) measurements clinical practice cardiac catheterization laboratory Germany . The registry aim collect data 2000 patient underwent FFR recording clinical reason . The main outcome parameter frequency coronary revascularization follow FFR . Secondary outcome parameter include distribution quantitative FFR result clinical practice , influence intracoronary versus intravenous adenosine distribution FFR result , rate complication result FFR measurement , average number FFR wire need per patient . Since study include large number patient undergo i.c . administration adenosine large number patient undergo i.v . administration adenosine , possible analyze whether route adenosine administration independent predictor FFR result .
DOC.detailed_description: Patient Inclusion Criteria All patient undergo measurement Fractional Flow Reserve use intracoronary pressure measurement clinical reason eligible inclusion . There exclusion criterion . Methods Following clinically indicate FFR measurement , patient data data concern angiographic stenosis severity well anatomic location interrogate lesion , method adenosine administration , FFR result document paper form . The form contain patient data except age gender well cath lab identify number serial number use FFR wire ( ) . The paper form transmit fax central study site Erlangen University data store evaluation perform . Recruitment period Recruitment start March 1 , 2017 terminate 2000 patient include . Number patient 2000 patient include . Outcome parameters The main outcome parameter frequency coronary revascularization follow FFR . Secondary outcome parameter include distribution quantitative FFR result clinical practice , rate complication result FFR measurement , average number FFR wire need per patient , well influence i.c . versus i.v . administration adenosine distribution obtain FFR result . All outcome parameter determine immediately end invasive coronary angiography ( coronary intervention , perform ) patient ( day 0 ) . No follow-up performed . Institutional Review Board ( IRB ) The study protocol approve IRB Faculty Medicine , University Erlangen-Nürnberg ( File Number 4_15B ) . Patient consent waive since data completely anonymized study-specific intervention perform .
